page.title: 19Local Staffordshire dialect
page.content:
We continued our conversation with our local gentleman.He told us: "I arna used to this sowta thing" (I'm not used to this sort of thing) "I'm sorry I couldnee elp thee much mower" (I'm sorry I couldn't help you much more) "Say thee" (See you-Goodbye)
Less people talk with a broad accent now,than they did a generation ago.We think this is because people listen to radio and television more.People move around the country much more,both on holiday and to live in different places.Everybody mixes much more and not many people spend their lives in one isolated area.
